data.description: IntroductionASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.The Glass and Ceramics Development department at ASML in Wilton, Connecticut is seeking an intern to work in the  Applied Metrology and Analytics team on computer vision and image processing for optical metrology applications.  The Glass and Ceramics Development department (GCD)  is a multi-disciplinary group of engineers and scientists focused on bringing innovation and quality to glass and ceramics products, creating technology solutions to meet product performance, cost, and manufacturing requirements throughout the product lifecycle, and applying our product, competencies, and process experience to deliver excellence in glass and ceramics in collaboration with product functional and factory teams.This internship is during the summer of 2026, lasting approximately 12 weeks.  This position is located on-site in Wilton, CT. It requires onsite presence to attend in-person work-related events, trainings and meetings and to further ensure teamwork, collaboration and innovation.Your assignmentThe main focus of this position will be to:Develop computer vision and image processing algorithms for optical metrology applications.  This work may include:Image stitchingFeature recognitionDeveloping a software packa.ge to standardize image processingPerformance analysisCollaborate with the team in metrology image data collection and the development of software and analysis tools.Understand technical requirements and drive to a solution that meets them.Clearly document and communicate progress, findings, and insights to stakeholders.Your profileEducation and experiencePursuing Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and or Optical Engineering with experience in image processing, having completed at least 2 yearsPursuing Master's degree in computer science or Masters/PhD in mathematics/physics/optical engineering or related fieldsExperience  in writing software: MATLAB, Python , C/C++, JavaExperience in computer vision and the development of image processing algorithms and software Familiarity with software version management e.g. Git, SVN, GitHub, Bitbucket A strong background of course work in computer science, mathematics or computational physics/engineering with a focus on computer vision and image processing.A basic understanding of optical measurement techniques (e.g. interferometry, optical sensors) and imaging systems.Have strong written and oral communicative skillsDemonstrated “team player” with a quality orientation and interpersonal skills and a commitment to achieving results on time;Be able to interface with multidisciplinary groups and work effectively in a team and be willing to take on responsibility, follow throughExperience with data visualization techniquesSkillsTo thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.Results driven; able to demonstrate ownership, accountability, and commitment to achieving results on time.Identify bottlenecks and drive improvements.Ability to complete assignments with attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered in the course of work.Can learn and apply new information or skills.Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency and professionalism.Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads.Work independently or as part of a team and follow through on assignments with minimal supervision.Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication. Have strong written and oral communicative skills and the ability to communicate effectively within your team.Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with co-workers and customer.Demonstrated “team player” with a quality orientation and interpersonal skillsAdditional Responsibilities:There is potential for exposure to strong magnetic fields, high voltage and currents.This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the United States Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.Inclusion and diversityASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce.
